appetizers.description: These beautiful onion rings are cooked in chicken grease to really bring out the flavor.
These buffalo finger chickens will melt in your mouth and in your hand.
Crushed apples off the coast of California are put into a blender and had sugar and cinnamon added to it.

cold sandwiches.description: This sandwich was crafted by a two year old in the mountains of Denver. Fresh ham from the farm off Pigs R Us Farm.
A classic as old as the dinosaurs. This PB&J sandwich will make you wish your mom still packed your school lunches.
The turkey was unfrozen weeks ago adding a very unique flavor to the mix that you'll get no where else.

hot sandwiches.description: Why eat it cold when you can microwave it and eat it hot. This Hot Ham Sandwich will leave you wanting more.
Heating up a cold PB&J sandwich to extreme temperatures excites the flavors and creates new tastes.
Hot Turkey is cooked to a nice temp of 200 degrees. Keep water close by because you'll need it to cool your tongue.

desserts.description: Classic Chocolate pie freshly unfrozen from the freezer. If not fully unfrozen, then wait 20 minutes and it'll be good.
This pumpkin pie is to die for. Literally 3 people have already died from it.
Kids love it and so do Adults and yet it's still not ice cream.

drinks.description: This is a poor man's drink but the lemonade covers up the bitter taste of vodka.
Milk straight from the cow out back. We added a little sugar to add a bit of sweetness to it.
The Doctor is in and he's prescribing Dr. Pepper. It'll shine up old pennies and also taste good while doing it.
